heading: marketwatch joins up with aol
subheading: cbs' financial site will provide its news to aol services in a $21 million, three-year deal.
author: reuters
text: new york -- internet service provider america online inc. and marketwatch.com inc. said tuesday they signed a $21 million deal for cbs marketwatch to provide financial news to aol services. under the terms of the three-year deal, marketwatch.com, which is partly owned by cbs corp., will pay $21 million in cash and promotions to become an anchor tenant in several of aol's online business areas, the companies said in a statement.the companies will share advertising revenue generated from designated areas on aol that contain cbs marketwatch content.additionally, the deal calls for the creation of several online links from aol to a joint cbs marketwatch/aol site. the two companies will also jointly conduct online polls to be used in cbs marketwatch television programming.the deal expands marketwatch.com's relationship with compuserve internet service, a unit of aol.shares of marketwatch.com quickly rose $4.875 to $50.25 in trading on nasdaq monday while shares of aol were up $1.75 at $102.59 on the new york stock exchange.copyright
